main_content: I’m Uzay (pronounced ooze-eye ), undergrad studying Math & CS , physics at MIT. I do theory of deep learning research in the Isola lab , and am currently particularly interested in a) the dynamics of in context adaptivity, and b) building robust legible world models that allow for improved long horizon performance and human empowerment. I am currently looking for research opportunities for the spring/especially summer period, so feel free to reach out. Interests: poetry/literature, writing , climbing, pure math, programming, mountains Things I get up to: trying to get better at research Amateur poetry, philosophy and writing I think AI will change the world and want to figure out what to do about it at MAIA I want to build better interfaces for learning and creativity using AI. Things I have affiliation to: Pika , Fabric, Emergent Ventures , France. Links: twitter , github , goodreads . Check out my blog - Here is some stuff I’ve written: on climbing , year review , beyond good and evil . Or if you are curious a list of some things I’ve done (research/projects), like this paper or this knowledge management software . I’d recommend my wiki if you want to get a deep dive into a lot of the things I’m interested in. Here’s a subset of my dear friends: Yudhi , Hamidah , Kaivu , Will , Gavin , Euan , Nils , Kai , Atticus . Email: zef (at) mit (dot) edu Copyright © 2019-2025 Uzay Girit
